application.algorithms.lof.LofConfiguration module

class application.algorithms.lof.LofConfiguration.LofConfiguration(data_file: str = 'multi-dataset.csv', model_name: str = 'model.pkl', report_file: str = 'report.csv', seed: int = 42, n_neighbors: int = 20, algorithm: str = 'auto', leaf_size: int = 30, metric: str = 'minkowski', p: int = 2, contamination: float = 0.1, n_jobs: int = 1, novelty: bool = True)[source]

Bases: AlgorithmConfigurator

Configuration class for the LOF algorithm.

n_neighbors

Number of neighbors to use. Defaults to 20.

Type:

int

algorithm

Algorithm to use for computing the nearest neighbors. Defaults to “auto”.

Type:

str

leaf_size

Leaf size passed to BallTree or KDTree. Defaults to 30.

Type:

int

metric

The distance metric to use for the tree. Defaults to “minkowski”.

Type:

str

p

Power parameter for the Minkowski metric. Defaults to 2.

Type:

int

metric_params

Additional keyword arguments for the metric function. Defaults to None.

Type:

dict, optional

contamination

The amount of contamination of the data set, i.e., the proportion of outliers in the data set. Defaults to 0.1.

Type:

float

n_jobs

The number of parallel jobs to run for neighbors search. Defaults to 1.

Type:

int

novelty

Whether to use LOF for novelty detection. Defaults to True.

Type:

bool

algorithm: str = 'auto'
contamination: float = 0.1
leaf_size: int = 30
metric: str = 'minkowski'
metric_params = None
n_jobs: int = 1
n_neighbors: int = 20
novelty: bool = True
p: int = 2
